verses.verse: Again, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Speak <S%H1696><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and say <S%H559><s%> to them, 'When <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> makes <S%H6381><s%> a difficult <S%H6381><s%> vow, <S%H5088><s%> he [shall be valued] according to your valuation <S%H6187><s%> of persons <S%H5315><s%> belonging to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

'If your valuation <S%H6187><s%> is of the male <S%H2145><s%> from twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> even to sixty <S%H8346><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver, <S%H3701><s%> after the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary. <S%H6944><s%>
'Or if <S%H518><s%> it is a female, <S%H5347><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be thirty <S%H7970><s%> shekels. <S%H8255><s%>

'And if <S%H518><s%> it be from five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> even to twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> for the male <S%H2145><s%> shall be twenty <S%H6242><s%> shekels, <S%H8255><s%> and for the female <S%H5347><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> shekels. <S%H8255><s%>

'But if <S%H518><s%> [they are] from a month <S%H2320><s%> even up to five <S%H2568><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old, <S%H1121><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be five <S%H2568><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> for the male, <S%H2145><s%> and for the female <S%H5347><s%> your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be three <S%H7969><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>

'And if <S%H518><s%> [they are] from sixty <S%H8346><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> and upward, <S%H4605><s%> if <S%H518><s%> it is a male, <S%H2145><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be fifteen <S%H2568><s%> <S%H6240><s%> shekels, <S%H8255><s%> and for the female <S%H5347><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> shekels. <S%H8255><s%>

'But if <S%H518><s%> he is poorer <S%H4134><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> your valuation, <S%H6187><s%> then he shall be placed <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the priest, <S%H3548><s%> and the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H9437><s%> him; according <S%H5921><s%> <S%H6310><s%> to the means <S%H3027><s%> <S%H5381><s%> of the one who vowed, <S%H5087><s%> the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H9437><s%> him.

'Now if <S%H518><s%> it is an animal <S%H929><s%> of the kind which <S%H834><s%> men can present <S%H7126><s%> as an offering <S%H7133><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> such <S%H834><s%> that one gives <S%H5414><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> shall be holy. <S%H6944><s%>

'He shall not replace <S%H2498><s%> it or exchange <S%H4171><s%> it, a good <S%H2896><s%> for a bad, <S%H7451><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a bad <S%H7451><s%> for a good; <S%H2896><s%> or if <S%H518><s%> he does <S%H4171><s%> exchange <S%H4171><s%> animal <S%H929><s%> for animal, <S%H929><s%> then both it and its substitute <S%H8545><s%> shall become <S%H1961><s%> holy. <S%H6944><s%>

'If, <S%H518><s%> however, it is any <S%H3605><s%> unclean <S%H2931><s%> animal <S%H929><s%> of the kind which <S%H834><s%> men do not present <S%H7126><s%> as an offering <S%H7133><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> then he shall place <S%H5975><s%> the animal <S%H929><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the priest. <S%H3548><s%>

'And the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H9437><s%> it as either <S%H996><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H996><s%> bad; <S%H7451><s%> as you, the priest, <S%H3548><s%> value <S%H6187><s%> it, so <S%H3651><s%> it shall be.
'But if <S%H518><s%> he should ever <S%H1350><s%> [wish to] redeem <S%H1350><s%> it, then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> one-fifth of it to your valuation. <S%H6187><s%>

'Now if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> consecrates <S%H6942><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> as holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall value <S%H9437><s%> it as either <S%H996><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H996><s%> bad; <S%H7451><s%> as the priest <S%H3548><s%> values <S%H9437><s%> it, so <S%H3651><s%> it shall stand. <S%H6965><s%>

'Yet if <S%H518><s%> the one who consecrates <S%H6942><s%> it should [wish to] redeem <S%H1350><s%> his house, <S%H1004><s%> then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> one-fifth of your valuation <S%H6187><s%> price <S%H3701><s%> to it, so that it may be his.

'Again, if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> consecrates <S%H6942><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> part of the fields <S%H7704><s%> of his own property, <S%H272><s%> then your valuation <S%H6187><s%> shall be proportionate <S%H6310><s%> to the seed <S%H2233><s%> needed for it: a homer <S%H9149><s%> of barley <S%H8184><s%> seed <S%H2233><s%> at fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>
'If <S%H518><s%> he consecrates <S%H6942><s%> his field <S%H7704><s%> as of the year <S%H8141><s%> of jubilee, <S%H3104><s%> according to your valuation <S%H6187><s%> it shall stand. <S%H6965><s%>

'If <S%H518><s%> he consecrates <S%H6942><s%> his field <S%H7704><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the jubilee, <S%H3104><s%> however, then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall calculate <S%H2803><s%> the price <S%H3701><s%> for him proportionate <S%H6310><s%> to the years <S%H8141><s%> that are left <S%H3498><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the year <S%H8141><s%> of jubilee; <S%H3104><s%> and it shall be deducted <S%H1639><s%> from your valuation. <S%H6187><s%>

'And if <S%H518><s%> the one who consecrates <S%H6942><s%> it should ever <S%H1350><s%> wish to redeem <S%H1350><s%> the field, <S%H7704><s%> then he shall add <S%H3254><s%> one-fifth of your valuation <S%H6187><s%> price <S%H3701><s%> to it, so that it may pass <S%H6965><s%> to him.

'Yet if <S%H518><s%> he will not redeem <S%H1350><s%> the field, <S%H7704><s%> but has sold <S%H4376><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> to another <S%H312><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> it may no <S%H3808><s%> longer <S%H5750><s%> be redeemed; <S%H1350><s%>

and when it reverts <S%H3318><s%> in the jubilee, <S%H3104><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> like a field <S%H7704><s%> set <S%H9172><s%> apart; <S%H9172><s%> it shall be for the priest <S%H3548><s%> as his property. <S%H272><s%>

'Or if <S%H518><s%> he consecrates <S%H6942><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> a field <S%H7704><s%> which he has bought, <S%H4736><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is not a part of the field <S%H7704><s%> of his own property, <S%H272><s%>

then the priest <S%H3548><s%> shall calculate <S%H2803><s%> for him the amount <S%H4373><s%> of your valuation <S%H6187><s%> up to the year <S%H8141><s%> of jubilee; <S%H3104><s%> and he shall on that day <S%H3117><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> your valuation <S%H6187><s%> as holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

'In the year <S%H8141><s%> of jubilee <S%H3104><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> shall return <S%H7725><s%> to the one from whom <S%H834><s%> he bought <S%H7069><s%> it, to whom <S%H834><s%> the possession <S%H272><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> belongs.

'Every <S%H3605><s%> valuation <S%H6187><s%> of yours, moreover, shall be after the shekel <S%H8255><s%> of the sanctuary. <S%H6944><s%> The shekel <S%H8255><s%> shall be twenty <S%H6242><s%> gerahs. <S%H1626><s%>

'However, <S%H389><s%> a first-born among animals, <S%H929><s%> which <S%H834><s%> as a first-born belongs to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> man <S%H376><s%> may consecrate <S%H6942><s%> it; whether <S%H518><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H518><s%> sheep, <S%H7716><s%> it is the Lord's.

'But if <S%H518><s%> [it is] among the unclean <S%H2931><s%> animals, <S%H929><s%> then he shall redeem <S%H6299><s%> it according to your valuation, <S%H6187><s%> and add <S%H3254><s%> to it one-fifth of it; and if <S%H518><s%> it is not redeemed, <S%H1350><s%> then it shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> according to your valuation. <S%H6187><s%>

'Nevertheless, <S%H389><s%> anything <S%H3605><s%> which <S%H834><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> sets <S%H2763><s%> apart <S%H2763><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> out of all <S%H3605><s%> that he has, of man <S%H120><s%> or animal <S%H929><s%> or of the fields <S%H7704><s%> of his own property, <S%H272><s%> shall not be sold <S%H4376><s%> or redeemed. <S%H1350><s%> Anything <S%H3605><s%> devoted <S%H9172><s%> to destruction <S%H2763><s%> is most <S%H6944><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

'No <S%H3808><s%> <S%H3605><s%> one <S%H3605><s%> who <S%H834><s%> may have been set <S%H2763><s%> apart <S%H2763><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> men <S%H120><s%> shall be ransomed; <S%H6299><s%> he shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put <S%H4191><s%> to death. <S%H4191><s%>

'Thus all <S%H3605><s%> the tithe <S%H4643><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> of the seed <S%H2233><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> or of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of the tree, <S%H6086><s%> is the Lord <S%H3068><s%>'s; it is holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord.
'If, <S%H518><s%> therefore, a man <S%H376><s%> wishes <S%H1350><s%> to redeem <S%H1350><s%> part of his tithe, <S%H4643><s%> he shall add <S%H3254><s%> to it one-fifth of it.

'And for every <S%H3605><s%> tenth <S%H4643><s%> part <S%H4643><s%> of herd <S%H1241><s%> or flock, <S%H6629><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> passes <S%H5674><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the rod, <S%H7626><s%> the tenth <S%H6224><s%> one shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

'He is not to be concerned <S%H1239><s%> whether <S%H996><s%> [it is] good <S%H2896><s%> or bad, <S%H7451><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> shall he exchange <S%H4171><s%> it; or if <S%H518><s%> he does <S%H4171><s%> exchange <S%H4171><s%> it, then both it and its substitute <S%H8545><s%> shall become <S%H1961><s%> holy. <S%H6944><s%> It shall not be redeemed. <S%H1350><s%>' "

These <S%H428><s%> are the commandments <S%H4687><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H6680><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> at Mount <S%H2022><s%> Sinai. <S%H5514><s%>
